item.name: Get Single Domain Status and Categorization

request.description: Return domain status, security categories and content categories for a single domain.

item.name: REFERENCE ONLY Check Bulk domains against Investigate

request.description: This API method returns the domain status, which the quickest and easiest way to know whether a domain has been flagged as malicious by the Cisco Security Labs team (score of -1 for status), if it is believed to be safe (score of 1), or if it has yet to be given a status (score of 0).

item.name: Get Historical Data on a Domain

request.description: Get historical data from Umbrella resolvers for domains, IPs, and other resource records.
Get a list of co-occurences for the specified domain. Unusual or suspicious co-occurence can provide additional information regarding attacks.

Get a list of domain names that have been frequently seen requested around the same time (up to 60 seconds before or after) as the given domain name, but that are not frequently associated with other domain names.

Get security information on the domain with multiple scores or security features, each of which can be used to determine relevant datapoints to build insight on the reputation or security risk posed by the site.
The Umbrella Investigate Risk Score is based on an analysis of the lexical characteristics of the domain name and patterns in queries and requests to the domain.
Shows samples from the ThreatGrid database associated with a domain, IP or URL. Information about samples is provided in the form of checksums associated when looking up a specific host or IP.

The Inspect API takes in blocks of arbitrary text, and returns a list of formatted observables as a JSON object.
The Inspect API takes in blocks of arbitrary text, and returns a list of formatted observables as a JSON object.

Queries the Threat Response API for the disposition of the observable(s). This will return Judgements from your Modules about Observables, Sightings, or Sighting References. Judgement - an opinion held by an integrated product or data source about an observable at a given time.

exec: if (jsonData['data'][a]['module'] == 'AMP for Endpoints'){ // AMP for Endpoints
tests["=> Total count of sightings = " + jsonData['data'][a].data.sightings.count] = true;
tests["=> Count of verdicts =" + jsonData['data'][a].data.verdicts.count] = true;

request.description: Observe an Entity - return Sightings from your modules about any of the above entity types. Sighting - an observation of an observable. For example, an endpoint detecting a file hash detected on a filesystem, or on the network by a firewall.
Fetch References for an Entity - returns a list of URLs and names to which the user can go for more information. For example, to pivot to Umbrella for domain intelligence.
Fetch the list of available response actions and modules for a given observable.
Add a malicious sha256 to AMP Simple Custom Detections list named Quarantine.
